verses.verse: And Bezalel<WH1212> and Oholiab<WH171> shall work<WH6213>, and every<WH2450> wise-hearted<WH3820> man<WH376>, in whom<WH1992> Jehovah<WH3068> hath put<WH5414> wisdom<WH2451> and understanding<WH8394> to know<WH3045> how to work<WH6213> all the work<WH4399> for the service<WH5656> of the sanctuary<WH6944>, according to all that Jehovah<WH3068> hath commanded<WH6680>.

And Moses<WH4872> called<WH7121> Bezalel<WH1212> and Oholiab<WH171>, and every<WH2450> wise-hearted<WH3820> man<WH376>, in whose heart<WH3820> Jehovah<WH3068> had put<WH5414> wisdom<WH2451>, even every one whose heart<WH3820> stirred him up<WH5375> to come<WH7126> unto the work<WH4399> to do it<WH6213>:

and they received<WH3947> of<WH6440> Moses<WH4872> all the offering<WH8641> which the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> had brought<WH935> for the work<WH4399> of the service<WH5656> of the sanctuary<WH6944>, wherewith to make<WH6213> it<WH935>. And they brought yet unto him freewill-offerings<WH5071> every morning<WH1242>.
And all the wise men<WH2450>, that wrought<WH6213> all the work<WH4399> of the sanctuary<WH6944>, came<WH935> every man<WH376> from his work<WH4399> which they wrought<WH6213>;

and they spake<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, saying<WH559>, The people<WH5971> bring<WH935> much more<WH7235> than enough<WH1767> for the service<WH5656> of the work<WH4399> which Jehovah<WH3068> commanded<WH6680> to make<WH6213>.

And Moses<WH4872> gave commandment<WH6680>, and they caused it to be proclaimed<WH6963> throughout the camp<WH4264>, saying<WH559>, Let neither man<WH376> nor woman<WH802> make<WH6213> any more work<WH4399> for the offering<WH8641> of the sanctuary<WH6944>. So the people<WH5971> were restrained<WH3607> from bringing<WH935>.
For the stuff<WH4399> they had was sufficient<WH1767> for all the work<WH4399> to make<WH6213> it<WH3498>, and too much.

And all the wise-hearted<WH2450> men<WH3820> among them that wrought<WH6213> the work<WH4399> made<WH6213> the tabernacle<WH4908> with ten<WH6235> curtains<WH3407>; of fine twined<WH7806> linen<WH8336>, and blue<WH8504>, and purple<WH713>, and scarlet<WH8144>, with cherubim<WH3742>, the work<WH4639> of the skilful<WH2803> workman<WH6213>, Bezalel made them.

The length<WH753> of each<WH259> curtain<WH3407> was eight<WH8083> and twenty<WH6242> cubits<WH520>, and the breadth<WH7341> of each<WH259> curtain<WH3407> four<WH702> cubits<WH520>: all the curtains<WH3407> had one<WH259> measure<WH4060>.
And he coupled<WH2266> five<WH2568> curtains<WH3407> one<WH259> to another<WH259>: and the other five<WH2568> curtains<WH3407> he coupled<WH2266> one<WH259> to another<WH259>.

And he made<WH6213> loops<WH3924> of blue<WH8504> upon the edge<WH8193> of the one<WH259> curtain<WH3407> from the selvedge<WH7098> in the coupling<WH4225>: likewise he made<WH6213> in the edge<WH8193> of the curtain<WH3407> that was outmost<WH7020> in the second<WH8145> coupling<WH4225>.

Fifty <WH2572> loops<WH3924> made<WH6213> he in the one<WH259> curtain<WH3407>, and fifty<WH2572> loops<WH3924> made<WH6213> he in the edge<WH7097> of the curtain<WH3407> that was in the second<WH8145> coupling<WH4225>: the loops<WH3924> were opposite<WH6901> one<WH259> to another<WH259>.

And he made<WH6213> fifty<WH2572> clasps<WH7165> of gold<WH2091>, and coupled<WH2266> the curtains<WH3407> one<WH259> to another<WH259> with the clasps<WH7165>: so the tabernacle<WH4908> was one<WH259>.
And he made<WH6213> curtains<WH3407> of goats<WH5795>' hair for a tent<WH168> over the tabernacle<WH4908>: eleven<WH6249> curtains<WH3407> he made them<WH6213>.

The length<WH753> of each<WH259> curtain<WH3407> was thirty<WH7970> cubits<WH520>, and four<WH702> cubits<WH520> the breadth<WH7341> of each<WH259> curtain<WH3407>: the eleven<WH6249> curtains<WH3407> had one<WH259> measure<WH4060>.
And he coupled<WH2266> five<WH2568> curtains<WH3407> by themselves<WH8337>, and six curtains by themselves<WH3407>.

And he made<WH6213> fifty<WH2572> loops<WH3924> on the edge<WH8193> of the curtain<WH3407> that was outmost<WH7020> in the coupling<WH4225>, and fifty<WH2572> loops<WH3924> made<WH6213> he upon the edge<WH8193> of the curtain<WH3407> which was outmost in the second<WH8145> coupling<WH2279>.
And he made<WH6213> fifty<WH2572> clasps<WH7165> of brass<WH5178> to couple<WH2266> the tent<WH168> together<WH2266>, that it might be one<WH259>.
And he made<WH6213> a covering<WH4372> for the tent<WH168> of rams<WH352>' skins<WH5785> dyed red<WH119>, and a covering<WH4372> of<WH8476> sealskins<WH5785> above<WH4605>.
And he made<WH6213> the boards<WH7175> for the tabernacle<WH4908>, of acacia<WH7848> wood<WH6086>, standing up<WH5975>.
Ten <WH6235> cubits<WH520> was the length<WH753> of a board<WH7175>, and a cubit<WH520> and a half<WH2677> the breadth<WH7341> of each<WH259> board<WH7175>.
Each <WH259> board<WH7175> had two<WH8147> tenons<WH3027>, joined<WH7947> one<WH259> to<WH413> another<WH259>: thus did he make<WH6213> for all the boards<WH7175> of the tabernacle<WH4908>.
And he made<WH6213> the boards<WH7175> for the tabernacle<WH4908>: twenty<WH6242> boards<WH7175> for the south<WH5045> side<WH6285> southward<WH8486>;

and he made<WH6213> forty<WH705> sockets<WH134> of silver<WH3701> under the twenty<WH6242> boards<WH7175>; two<WH8147> sockets<WH134> under one<WH259> board<WH7175> for its two<WH8147> tenons<WH3027>, and two<WH8147> sockets<WH134> under another<WH259> board<WH7175> for its two<WH8147> tenons<WH3027>.
And for the second<WH8145> side<WH6763> of the tabernacle<WH4908>, on the north<WH6828> side<WH6285>, he made<WH6213> twenty<WH6242> boards<WH7175>,
and their forty<WH705> sockets<WH134> of silver<WH3701>; two<WH8147> sockets<WH134> under one<WH259> board<WH7175>, and two<WH8147> sockets<WH134> under another<WH259> board<WH7175>.
And for the hinder<WH3411> part of the tabernacle<WH4908> westward<WH3220> he made<WH6213> six<WH8337> boards<WH7175>.
And two<WH8147> boards<WH7175> made<WH6213> he for the corners<WH4742> of the tabernacle<WH4908> in the hinder part<WH3411>.

And they were double<WH8382> beneath<WH4295>; and in like<WH8382> manner<WH3162> they were entire unto the top<WH7218> thereof unto one<WH259> ring<WH2885>: thus he did<WH6213> to both<WH8147> of them in the two<WH8147> corners<WH4740>.
And there were eight<WH8083> boards<WH7175>, and their sockets<WH134> of silver<WH3701>, sixteen<WH8337> sockets<WH134>; under every<WH259> board<WH7175> two<WH8147> sockets<WH134>.
And he made<WH6213> bars<WH1280> of acacia<WH7848> wood<WH6086>; five<WH2568> for the boards<WH7175> of the one<WH259> side<WH6763> of the tabernacle<WH4908>,

and five<WH2568> bars<WH1280> for the boards<WH7175> of the other<WH8145> side<WH6763> of the tabernacle<WH4908>, and five<WH2568> bars<WH1280> for the boards<WH7175> of the tabernacle<WH4908> for the hinder part<WH3411> westward<WH3220>.
And he made<WH6213> the middle<WH8484> bar<WH1280> to pass<WH1272> through<WH8432> in the midst of the boards<WH7175> from the one end<WH7097> to the other<WH7097>.

And he overlaid<WH6823> the boards<WH7175> with gold<WH2091>, and made<WH6213> their rings<WH2885> of gold<WH2091> for places<WH1004> for the bars<WH1280>, and overlaid<WH6823> the bars<WH1280> with gold<WH2091>.

And he made<WH6213> the veil<WH6532> of blue<WH8504>, and purple<WH713>, and scarlet<WH8144>, and fine twined<WH7806> linen<WH8336>: with cherubim<WH3742>, the work<WH4639> of the skilful<WH2803> workman<WH6213>, made he it.

And he made<WH6213> thereunto four<WH702> pillars<WH5982> of acacia<WH7848>, and overlaid<WH6823> them with gold<WH2091>: their hooks<WH2053> were of gold<WH2091>: and he cast<WH3332> for them four<WH702> sockets<WH134> of silver<WH3701>.

And he made<WH6213> a screen<WH4539> for the door<WH6607> of the Tent<WH168>, of blue<WH8504>, and purple<WH713>, and scarlet<WH8144>, and fine twined<WH7806> linen<WH8336>, the work of the embroiderer<WH7551>;

and the five<WH2568> pillars<WH5982> of it with their hooks<WH2053>: and he overlaid<WH6823> their capitals<WH7218> and their fillets<WH2838> with gold<WH2091>; and their five<WH2568> sockets<WH134> were of brass<WH5178>.
